description: Works great with ExpressVPN client but when the extension is active, GNOME Shell quits unexpectedly on almost every wake-up from sleep.
It works without any hiccups with open source vpn using the private internet access servers (pia).
Always showing "VPN is down" when using with CyberGhost vpn, configured with openVPN service.
summary: Does not work with CyberGhost VPN

description: unless I am missing something...?

Haven't had any issues but you never know.
Then again why am using Linux if not for the thrill ;)
Seems to work with Nord. Thanks!!
Sadly it shows always "VPN is down!". Tired with cisco Anyconnect.
I have nordVPN installed and didn't recognize when the VPN was enabled.
Pretty good. I like it.
would be a nice addon but for me it is not working with wireguard

Displays an indicator of my vpn status as expected. I have the NordVPN client and it is working fine. 
Just wish there was a way I could change the text so it is less conspicuous - will probably poke around on the back end sometime.

If the indicator isn't working when you know you have your VPN running, then run this command: 
sudo -s apt-get install gcc rng-tools make automake autoconf dh-autoreconf file patch perl dh-make debhelper devscripts gnupg lintian quilt libtool pkg-config libssl-dev liblzo2-dev libpam0g-dev libpkcs11-helper1-dev openssl liblz4-dev liblz4-tool net-tools iproute2
spent hours, it is just driving me crazy, has anyone , got it working 18.04.3?
summary: works fine on my phone but not on Ubuntu 18.04.3

description:
Install the following and your indicator will work just fine:

sudo -s apt-get install gcc rng-tools make automake autoconf dh-autoreconf file patch perl dh-make debhelper devscripts gnupg lintian quilt libtool pkg-config libssl-dev liblzo2-dev libpam0g-dev libpkcs11-helper1-dev openssl liblz4-dev liblz4-tool net-tools iproute2
summary: If you have NordVPN - Do This to Make Indicator Work

description: Works fine.
summary: Works with Nordvpn after running the Terminal code

description: Nice extension but doesn't work with some VPN services.  Certainly not with Nord.

This app seems to depend on how you installed NordVPN as to whether it works or not. My solution was using the following terminal code to change the technology setting.
"nordvpn technology set openvpn" instead of "nordvpn technology set NordLynx" 
hope this helps others as well.
summary: NordVPN settings seem to effect outcomes

description:
Make sure you have ifconfig installed. Initially this didn't work for me. Looking through the code, I found and ran the actual VPN test and found that ifconfig wasn't installed by default.

(A) install ifconfig by running "sudo apt install net-tools"
(B) to the author, consider running a test to see if ifconfig is installed and throwing that error text into the top bar
(C) Hey Ubuntu... why isn't ifconfig installed? Isn't it a core part of any os install? (ubuntu 18.04 desktop, default install)

This extension needs net-tools to run properly:
Open a terminal and run... sudo apt install net-tools

After that it will start working straight away, i'm using SurfShark VPN
summary: Works spot on, but requires net-tools to work

description:
Been hacking Network Manager (nm-connection-editor) for years just because I wanted to see that my VPN was up, anyway that just stopped working (works ok and starts on boot but when you get to the desktop it drops) on Ubuntu 18.04. I stopped with Network Manager and set my VPN to start on boot as an Open VPN Service, and it works a treat, whoever made this YOU are a genius THANK YOU.

https://kifarunix.com/connect-to-vpn-automatically-on-ubuntu-20-04-18-04/

Worked instantly and I used it directly after adding NordVPN.
Then it didn't work but actually NordVPN was working and then thanks to the people who posted the instructions it now works again.
Good example of how humans overcome their own flawed genius?
Thanks for the free help to fix this! 5 estrellas!
summary: Worked, then it didn't.. now it does
